pr_title: Core Enhancement 1 - Place Module in Menu
pr_body:
The purpose of this PR is to track all the file changes and commits made. Mentors can review the changes and provide feedback. I will update the description as and when I push more commits. Plan Document: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Pl8JGa2hkYkmJzQOn9_mS8a4imDmqc2a/edit#heading=h.gewhdn9rqyeh
### Testing Instructions - Run `npm ci` because this PR involves re-building of assets - Either run the SQL update script or download and install https://drive.google.com/file/d/1R4962C-MFFS236UW0cTBPn48DucG0-Qr/view?usp=sharing for the Add Module Button Plugin - Test the frontend and backend placement flow which is summarized [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Pl8JGa2hkYkmJzQOn9_mS8a4imDmqc2a/edit#heading=h.a1fazatb2meo)
### Pull Request for - [x] Rendering Add Module Button in Frontend via Plugin - [x] Setting up ?pm=1 and rendering buttons and positions for it - [x] Passing data of position and menu assignment (pages) from the button to Add Module page - [x] Adding Preview link in backendâ€™s add/edit module page - [x] Setting up the Modal for Backend - [x] Setting up the frontend view for the Modal and returning the data
### Todo - Add a message to inform users that they need to login and they need permissions for ?pm=1 view
### Result After PR ### Overall Flow (Latest) https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xaiEEZfUkE_6p7jCZLss9udkjJiJKJnS/view?usp=sharing ### Frontend Flow https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/121345012-faa35f00-c941-11eb-9623-4bcbdbe8a3a4.mp4 ### Backend Flow ![modal](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/122350343-c5fb5d00-cf6a-11eb-8e83-4702c9b8a0f7.gif)
### Summary of Changes 1. Switcher Added in Global Configuration for Templates 2. Added the code in SQL Installation Script to set the default value of this Parameter upon the first installation 3. Add Module Button is displayed in `
` in Frontend when the above switcher is saved as 1 or True ![pr11-gs](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/120895734-f9b9b700-c63b-11eb-9681-f2aaeb6823f2.gif)
4. Set up the view for `?pm=1` in Frontend (Here `pm` stands for Place(ing) Module) 5. The button in (3) is linked to this view 6. The preview shows the `Add Module Here` button for every position ![pr2-gs](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/120895856-82d0ee00-c63c-11eb-955d-5d6742d377bf.gif) 7. The Add Module Button Works for Every Menu Page (not just index.php): ![pr111-gs](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/120914168-d03f7080-c6b9-11eb-95bb-f69e48ca4794.gif) 8. The Add Module Here Button is accessible as it also dictates the position: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/120916867-b27a0780-c6c9-11eb-907d-6e577b0e95ec.png)
9. Check for Permissions before displaying Place Modules Buttons for displaying the Add Modules Button and accessing the `?pm=1` view

![pr1-gs-perms](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/120920132-f590a680-c6da-11eb-85c8-510d912c4d7b.gif)
10. Work in Progress on a Controller to set Position by passing data from the button. It displays Menu ID, template ID and name of the position. ![pr1-gs-addPost](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/120928430-3c45c700-c702-11eb-9e0b-a7e2330befb0.gif) 11. Template ID in (10) is not required (I checked the databases and Models of Module's Add Methods) so it has been removed.
12. Rephrased Add Module Here button to Place Module Here to avoid confusion and generalize it for the Backend Preview Modal that we plan to implement. 13. Removed the HTML tags from language constants ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/120967977-dbf86900-c785-11eb-8089-b1dacf8f6c81.png)
14. Position is now pre-filled based on Frontend Placement Selection ![pr1-gs-posi](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/121176973-79cd6000-c87a-11eb-9346-b08176b25342.gif)
15. Menu Position is now pre-selected 16. Made a few semantic changes
### Potential Issues 1. There is a flaw in the get active menu item API for a multilingual website: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/121345588-ae0c5380-c942-11eb-806d-911fdedc92b2.png) https://docs.joomla.org/Menu_and_Menuitems_API_Guide#Active_Menuitem
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 651069724, 'comment_body': 'Isn't this switch only possible if the preview is allowed? If yes: you could make a dpendecy with showon="template_positions_display:1"', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 6, 14, 15, 49, 12, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'chmst', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 651076226, 'comment_body': "Actually, I've kept them independent so the ?pm (place module view) does not need ?tp (template positions to be enabled). I did this because many admins would prefer to have Add Modules enabled while only developers would know and require the need for Template Positions and also because Place Modules will be enabled by default upon installation. 

Should I keep Place Modules dependent on template_positions?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 6, 14, 15, 57, 12, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'YatharthVyas', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 653287242, 'comment_body': 'no, good argument', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 6, 17, 7, 9, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'chmst', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 659340944, 'comment_body': "```suggestion
(0, 'plg_system_addmodulebutton', 'plugin', 'addmodulebutton', 'system', 0, 1, 1, 0, 1, '', '', '', NULL, NULL, 0, 0);
```
The default value for the `checked_out` column has changed from zero to NULL. Maybe you have copied your SQL statement from an update SQL script which runs before the one which made that change (4.0.0-2020-05-29.sql) so still zero was used.

But here you can use NULL for the `checked_out` column.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 6, 27, 15, 49, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'richard67', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 659340980, 'comment_body': "```suggestion
(0, 'plg_system_addmodulebutton', 'plugin', 'addmodulebutton', 'system', 0, 1, 1, 0, 1, '', '', '', NULL, NULL, 0, 0);
```
Same as above.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 6, 27, 15, 50, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'richard67', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 659341171, 'comment_body': "It's not a big mistake, it would also work with zero. The rest of the recent SQL changes for adding that plugin to new installations and on updates looks ok to me.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 6, 27, 15, 51, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'richard67', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 659344343, 'comment_body': 'Thank you! This is very helpful. I will remember this for the next time', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 6, 27, 16, 16, 28, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'YatharthVyas', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 659344381, 'comment_body': 'Thank you!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 6, 27, 16, 16, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'YatharthVyas', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_body:
Project Repo PR: https://github.com/joomla-projects/gsoc21_core-enhancements/pull/1
Plan Document: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Pl8JGa2hkYkmJzQOn9_mS8a4imDmqc2a/edit#heading=h.gewhdn9rqyeh

<hr>

## Summary of Changes

### Frontend Flow:
This PR re-invents the unconventional method of placing modules from the Backend Dashboard to an easier to visualize series of steps where the users can visit a particular page in the Frontend (while logged in to an admin account) and from there, they can select the menu (automatically determined based on the page) and position of the Module by the means of buttons that reflect the output of where the module will be placed if the user proceeds to create it.


- **New Plugin**
    * Introduce a new system plugin `plg_system_addmodulebutton` for displaying the Add Module Button
    * This button is appended to the end of the `<main>` tag which is omnipresent on all pages. 
    * This button is only displayed when a user logs into the frontend using an account that has Module Add/Edit Permissions
    * Pressing this button adds `?pm=1` as a GET parameter in the URL. This is similar to the `?tp=1` parameter that is used for displaying [template positions](https://docs.joomla.org/Finding_module_positions_on_any_given_page)

![addModbtn](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/125053512-d2cf2480-e0c2-11eb-8421-0eff83c53222.gif)


- **Place Module** (`?pm=1`) **View** 
    * This view displays the current page will all possible template positions
    * Each position will have a button corresponding to it. This button can be used to select this position for placing the new module.
    * These buttons (to select position) redirect the user to a backend page having a URL like `administrator/index.php?option=com_modules&task=module.selectPosition&position=footer&menu=101` . This URL has 3 parts:
        1. `task=module.selectPosition` is used to call the selectPosition Controller in com_modules/module
        2. `&position=footer` is used to pass the position as a GET param
        3. `&menu=101` is used to pass the menu id of the current page as a GET param

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/125051372-8387f480-e0c0-11eb-95b1-fab84b104f47.png)

- **New Controller: /com_modules/Module/selectPosition**
   * Saves the Position and Menu ID which is passed as a GET param in URL by the previous step in the User State,
   * Redirects to Module Select View where user can select the Module Type
   * After the Module Type has been selected, these state items (Position and Menu ID) is used to pre-fill the Position Name and Menu ID

Here is a video demonstration of the overall frontend flow :

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/125059779-525ff200-e0c9-11eb-89c4-e60ccb5e19d4.mp4
 
<hr>

### Backend Flow:
Editing Modules in the Backend Admin Panel turned out to be a little tricky for the user if the template positions were not easy to visualize or if the User was unaware of the layout of the template positions. The old way for a user to get around this difficulty was to 
1. Visit the Global Configuration -> Templates -> Enable Template Positions
2. Visit Frontend
3. Append `?tp=1` as a param in the Page's URL (Might not be easy for users who do not have a technical background)
4. Remember the position name (Note: This view only shows active positions so they cannot even know where inactive positions are. Inactive means those positions that do not have a module to show in it)
5. Go back to the Admin Dashboard and select this position

To simplify all this into an easier and efficient method, a new modal has been added to select the positions via their preview. The video below demonstrates this new modal:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/125062858-783ac600-e0cc-11eb-9955-9fb4aa60c897.mp4

<hr>

### Testing Instructions
- Run `npm ci` because this PR involves re-building of assets
- Either run the SQL update script or download and install https://drive.google.com/file/d/1R4962C-MFFS236UW0cTBPn48DucG0-Qr/view?usp=sharing for the Add Module Button Plugin
- Test the frontend and backend placement flow summarized above. (The videos might be helpful)

<hr>

### Actual result AFTER applying this Pull Request
Refer to the two videos in the Summary of Changes section.

<hr>

### Documentation Changes Required
I'm not sure but I think this should be included in the Joomla Docs as a User Guide for the new feature.

<hr>

### Mentors
@chmst @nibra @bembelimen
(and thanks @richard67)

```
It seems you still haven't adjusted your editor or IDE to show you where you have tabs and where spaces. Here you have a mix of both. pr_title: Core Enhancement 2 -Incorporation of Modules in the Articles-Edit-View
pr_body:
The purpose of this PR is to track all the file changes and commits made. Mentors can review the changes and provide feedback.
I will update the description as and when I push more commits.

Plan Document: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Pl8JGa2hkYkmJzQOn9_mS8a4imDmqc2a/edit#heading=h.xzcjfqetxfhr

<hr>

- [x] Switcher in Article's Config Form to toggle the Imported Modules Tab 
- [x] New Tab in Article-Edit View for Imported Modules
- [x] New Button to Create New Module directly from Article Edit View using an editor-xtd Plugin (IN PROGRESS)

### Summary of Changes

#### Option to Enable the Tab via Article Edit View's Configure Edit Screen Tab
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/123754320-62f9b680-d8d8-11eb-8b45-ef30505deb76.png)

#### Option to Enable the Tab via Article's Global Config From (Under Editing Layout Tab)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/123754446-87559300-d8d8-11eb-9b45-c3a4ddc99315.png)

#### The Imported Modules Tab
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/123754178-3e054380-d8d8-11eb-80e0-a63f46f10d10.png)

#### New Module Editor-xtd Button
1. For TinyMCE

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/123755176-48740d00-d8d9-11eb-810c-131f00718704.png)

2. For CodeMirror

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/123755370-722d3400-d8d9-11eb-9c50-071003094bc8.png)

pr_title: [5.2] [GSoC 21] Core Enhancement 2 - Incorporation of Modules in Articles-Edit-View
pr_body:
Project Repo PR: https://github.com/joomla-projects/gsoc21_core-enhancements/pull/8 Plan Document: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Pl8JGa2hkYkmJzQOn9_mS8a4imDmqc2a/edit#heading=h.xzcjfqetxfhr
## Summary of Changes 1. **Create Module in Article Edit Screen**
Users can add Modules in Articles in Joomla. This is done with the help of the Module xtd-editor Plugin. However, this Plugin opens a Modal that only allows the user to select a pre-existing module, ie. there is no option to add a new module directly in the Article Edit View. To enhance that, this PR introduces a button to Create Modules directly in the Article Edit View:
![add module](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/125294497-f05df180-e341-11eb-9f98-d862a5d9185f.gif)
2. **Imported Modules Tab**
Note: To test this feature, you must enable "Show Imported Modules" in the com_content Global Configuration OR in the Configure Edit Screen Tab. Also, remember that the tab is only visible when you **Import a Module** and **Save** it.
![configure](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/125298326-a971fb00-e345-11eb-9202-028e9bc8bb95.gif) * Users have no option to ascertain information about the Modules imported in an article (they can only see the module id)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/125299068-67958480-e346-11eb-96a3-2a52fbcd9b8b.png) * Additionally, these modules cannot be directly edited in the Article Edit View.
![edit](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/125299003-55b3e180-e346-11eb-88b2-290dacb05dea.gif) * There is no user-friendly way to removing these modules. It requires a person to backspace the `{loadmoduleid id}` string from the article text which may not seem very intuitive to someone that is not tech-savvy. So to make this process more smooth, the users can now remove the tab with the click of a button in this tab
![remove](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/124258965-9ee88200-db4b-11eb-8ed4-793ab01c0e6d.gif) ### Testing Instructions 1. Run `npm ci` to rebuild the assets 2. Enable the Imported Modules Tab (Global Configuration -> Articles -> Editing Layout -> Show Imported Modules Switcher) 3. Follow the GIFs above ### Documentation Changes Required I'm not sure ### Mentors @chmst @nibra @bembelimen (and thanks @richard67)

pr_body:
This is a substitute for Task 3. The aim of this PR is to incorporate Workflows in com_modules

### Summary of Changes
1. Copied the functions of Workflows from com_content to com_modules (and made the necessary changes)
2. Modified the Installation SQL script
3. Created a new menu for Modules Workflows (displayed in left sidebar of atum when module workflows are enabled)
4. Workflow transitions now work
5. Modules Workflows CRUD works
6. Modules can be created and updated with workflow
7. Added a field to select the workflow for a module
8. When creating new modules you have to select a workflow and when you save, the default stage under this workflow_id is set as the initial stage of the module.
9. When editing exiting modules, instead of the workflow_id field, the workflow transition field is shown and this works similar to com_content.
10. Language constants for workflow dropdown are now loaded
11. Update SQL script added
12. Added the correspondent of `ContentHelper:onPrepareForm` to ModuleModel. This function adds the default workflow option to the workflow dropdown


Needs work:

1. More documentation


### Testing Instructions
After a fresh install:
1, Go to Modules -> Options -> Integrations and Enable Workflows
2. Test the transitions in modules view
3. Test CRUD for workflows, stages and transitions in Modules: Workflows


### Expected result AFTER applying this Pull Request
Workflows implemented


### Documentation Changes Required
Yes. Something on the lines of https://docs.joomla.org/Publishing_Workflow_Implementation#Implement_com_workflow_into_your_extension

It is not always possible (inherited stuff), but where possible you could keep it in your mind.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 7, 28, 18, 35, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'chmst', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 678965307, 'comment_body': 'Thank you, I will keep this in mind', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 7, 29, 9, 4, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'YatharthVyas', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 680141503, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
INSERT INTO "#__workflow_associations" ("item_id", "stage_id", "extension")
SELECT "id", 2, 'com_modules.module' FROM "#__modules";
```
Fix MySQL names quoting used for PostgreSQL causing the PostgreSQL system test fail with an SQL syntax error when installing Joomla.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 7, 30, 18, 24, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'richard67', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 680152688, 'comment_body': 'Thank you! SELECT setval('#__assets_id_seq', 94, false);
```
Auto-increment columns work differently in PostgreSQL than they do in MySQL. They use something called sequence, and here you have to adjust the next value of that sequence to your changes.

The same has to be done elsewhere in the PostgreSQL base.sql file where you have added new records to the inserts.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 1, 13, 45, 20, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'richard67', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 680513998, 'comment_body': "```suggestion

pr_body:
Project Repo PR: https://github.com/joomla-projects/gsoc21_core-enhancements/pull/10

## Summary of Changes

### Access
- The corresponding access.xml actions have been added.

### Articles Model
- The `getListQuery()` method joins the old query with workflow_associations to also consider the workflow stages that belong to `com_content.articles` only.

### SQL Changes:
- The following have been added to the Database Tables:
    - 1 new workflow: `COM_WORKFLOW_BASIC_WORKFLOW_MODULES`
    - 1 new stage:  `COM_WORKFLOW_BASIC_STAGE`
    - 3 new transitions: Publish, Unpublish, and Trash
- Workflow Associations have been created for all existing modules via an update script / a query during Installation.

### Introduce a new Backend Menu Item
- A new menu item for Modules: Workflows to execute CRUD for `com_modules`

### Option to Enable Workflow Integration
- This can be toggled from Global Configuration

### Searchtools Filtering
- Option to filter modules via their stage

### ModulesComponent.php
- Added necessary functions that are used by Workflow Plugins (Workflows, Featuring and Publishing)

### Module Model
- The get query now takes into account the workflow stage associated with each module.
- Added Workflow before and after Save events
- Added a function to get the initial stage for a module (default workflow and default stage)
- Added a query to create workflow association while duplicating modules
- Added a function that prepares the workflow field

### Modules Model
- Join the query with workflow associations
- Add a filterForm function to filter based on workflow stage

### Modules Template:
- Added workflows column to the table
- This column is conditionally rendered when workflows are enabled
- Added workflows field to default batch body

## The Flow:
1. When creating new modules you have to select a workflow and when you save, the default stage under this workflow_id is set as the initial stage of the module.
2. When editing exiting modules, the workflow transition field is shown instead of the workflow_id field, which works similarly to com_content.

#### New Modules: Select Workflow 

(Permanent similar to workflow assignment for com_content)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/127371792-76191d17-2556-4147-be8d-6e95f835f657.png)


#### Edit Existing Modules: Transition Field

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/127372084-a33fff64-3a05-4189-a00e-0d6ac782b6f9.png)


## Testing Instructions

After a fresh install:
1, Go to Modules (Site or Admin) -> Options -> Integrations -> Enable Workflows
2. Test the transitions in modules view
3. Test CRUD for workflows, stages, and transitions in Modules: Workflows
4. Test Batch and Duplicate



## Expected result AFTER applying this Pull Request

Workflows are integrated into Modules and work as expected.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/129226377-79bddb17-7968-4bf7-9599-f206ff9853e2.mp4


## Documentation Changes Required

Possibly yes. Something on the lines of https://docs.joomla.org/Publishing_Workflow_Implementation#Implement_com_workflow_into_your_extension


## Mentors

@chmst @nibra @bembelimen
(And special thanks to @richard67)

pr_title: Core Enhancement 3 - Merge Featured into Articles
pr_body:
The purpose of this PR is to track all the file changes and commits made. Mentors can review the changes and provide feedback. I will update the description as and when I push more commits. Plan Document: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Pl8JGa2hkYkmJzQOn9_mS8a4imDmqc2a/edit#heading=h.t5tri5tytv7q
- [x] Drop-down selector in Articles view - [x] Merge Model - [x] Merge tmpl files - [x] Merge View - [x] Merge Controller - [x] Update all links pointing to `view=featured` - [ ] Test Sample Data - [ ] Remove Featured files - [x] Update Link of Featured Articles Menu Item Edit: Merge Table has been removed from the above list because I feel that both the files (in [/src/Table/](https://github.com/joomla-projects/gsoc21_core-enhancements/tree/4.1-dev/administrator/components/com_content/src/Table)) play an essential role and they must be different ## Summary of Changes ### [A] New Selector Dropdown A searchtools selector is added that can be used to toggle between: Option | Value ------------ | ------------- All | "" Unfeatured | 0 Featured | 1 ![dropdown](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/128350490-c5d83ab1-2ffb-42f7-8ecc-27cde5d658c5.gif)
### [B] Model Merged - A new method to return the featured selector filter parameter using the getUserState from request ```php $featured = $this->getUserStateFromRequest($this->context . '.featured', 'featured', ''); ``` - The advantage of the above is that we can also pass the value as a GET param to the URL which helps us to make redirect URLs that can initialize the value of this dropdown - `$featured` variable is used as a condition to manipulate the query to adjust to Featured
### [C] Templates Merged - We use `state->get('featured')` to conditonally render the template code as per featured or not.
### [D] Views Merged - We use `state->get('featured')` to conditonally render the toolbar options
### [E] Controller Merged - Merged the delete function from FeaturedController
## Testing Instructions - Visit the Articles View and ensure that everything works as it did before. - Test workflows and filters too - Ensure that the tmpl and view (and all other MVC files) are common for both featured and articles
## Expected result AFTER applying this Pull Request Everything works normally

pr_title: [5.2] [GSoC 21] Core Enhancement 3 - Merge Featured into Articles
pr_body:
Project Repo PR: https://github.com/joomla-projects/gsoc21_core-enhancements/pull/11 Plan Document: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Pl8JGa2hkYkmJzQOn9_mS8a4imDmqc2a/edit#heading=h.t5tri5tytv7q
- [x] Drop-down selector in Articles view - [x] Merge Model - [x] Merge tmpl files - [x] Merge View - [x] Merge Controller - [x] Update all links pointing to `view=featured` - [x] Update Link of Featured Articles Menu Item - [x] Remove Featured files ## Summary of Changes ### [A] New Selector Dropdown A searchtools selector is added that can be used to toggle between: Option | Value ------------ | ------------- All | "" Unfeatured | 0 Featured | 1 ![dropdown](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/128350490-c5d83ab1-2ffb-42f7-8ecc-27cde5d658c5.gif)
### [B] Model Merged - A new method to return the featured selector filter parameter using the getUserState from request ```php $featured = $this->getUserStateFromRequest($this->context . '.featured', 'featured', ''); ``` - The advantage of the above is that we can also pass the value as a GET param to the URL which helps us to make redirect URLs that can initialize the value of this dropdown - `$featured` variable is used as a condition to manipulate the query to adjust to Featured
### [C] Templates Merged - We use `state->get('featured')` to conditonally render the template code as per featured or not.
### [D] Views Merged - We use `state->get('featured')` to conditonally render the toolbar options
### [E] Controller Merged - Merged the delete function from FeaturedController
## Testing Instructions - Visit the Articles View and ensure that everything works as it did before. - Test workflows and filters too - Ensure that the tmpl and view (and all other MVC files) are common for both featured and articles
## Expected result AFTER applying this Pull Request Everything works normally
## Mentors @chmst @nibra @bembelimen (and thanks @richard67)

pr_title: Display Modules Position Badge Background Color based on the Active Template Positions
pr_body:
Pull Request for Issue #2 

### Summary of Changes

Added a new model `getValidPositions` that performs the following:
1. Fetch the active template from the database (1 Query)
2. Get the `templateDetails.xml` file corresponding to the template received as a result of Step 1
3. Store these positions in an array and return it

The array returned from the above model method will be used in the `_getList` function as:
1. Stored the result of the `getValidPositions`  method in an array
2. After fetching all modules from the database for rendering, perform a check whether each module row's position exists in the array of step 1
        If `yes`, set `$row->activePosition` to `true`
        If `no`, set `$row->activePosition` to `false`

Finally, in the `tmpl` file, we use this `activePosition` flag to conditionally select between `bg-primary` and `bg-secondary`


Extra:
Added a few missing template positions to the XML file:
For example, Atum's cpanel-system:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/122663364-79589180-d1b7-11eb-83d4-286e380ea5b1.png)


<hr>

### Testing Instructions
Visit the database and change the value of one of the module's positions to a random string.
 
**Note**: Positions for multi-lingual website could be an edge case but I am unable to set up a multi-lingual site on my local workstation so I'm unable to confirm this

<hr>

### Actual result BEFORE applying this Pull Request

All badges have the same `bg-primary` class


<hr>

### Expected result AFTER applying this Pull Request

Badges for In-active (not of the active template) Positions have a `bg-secondary` class

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/122663117-d2272a80-d1b5-11eb-8a94-57e00c94507b.png)



<hr>

### Documentation Changes Required
I don't know

pr_body:
Project Repo PR: https://github.com/joomla-projects/gsoc21_core-enhancements/pull/1
Plan Document: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Pl8JGa2hkYkmJzQOn9_mS8a4imDmqc2a/edit#heading=h.gewhdn9rqyeh

<hr>

## Summary of Changes

### Frontend Flow:
This PR re-invents the unconventional method of placing modules from the Backend Dashboard to an easier to visualize series of steps where the users can visit a particular page in the Frontend (while logged in to an admin account) and from there, they can select the menu (automatically determined based on the page) and position of the Module by the means of buttons that reflect the output of where the module will be placed if the user proceeds to create it.


- **New Plugin**
    * Introduce a new system plugin `plg_system_addmodulebutton` for displaying the Add Module Button
    * This button is appended to the end of the `<main>` tag which is omnipresent on all pages. 
    * This button is only displayed when a user logs into the frontend using an account that has Module Add/Edit Permissions
    * Pressing this button adds `?pm=1` as a GET parameter in the URL. This is similar to the `?tp=1` parameter that is used for displaying [template positions](https://docs.joomla.org/Finding_module_positions_on_any_given_page)

![addModbtn](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/125053512-d2cf2480-e0c2-11eb-8421-0eff83c53222.gif)


- **Place Module** (`?pm=1`) **View** 
    * This view displays the current page will all possible template positions
    * Each position will have a button corresponding to it. This button can be used to select this position for placing the new module.
    * These buttons (to select position) redirect the user to a backend page having a URL like `administrator/index.php?option=com_modules&task=module.selectPosition&position=footer&menu=101` . This URL has 3 parts:
        1. `task=module.selectPosition` is used to call the selectPosition Controller in com_modules/module
        2. `&position=footer` is used to pass the position as a GET param
        3. `&menu=101` is used to pass the menu id of the current page as a GET param

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/125051372-8387f480-e0c0-11eb-95b1-fab84b104f47.png)

- **New Controller: /com_modules/Module/selectPosition**
   * Saves the Position and Menu ID which is passed as a GET param in URL by the previous step in the User State,
   * Redirects to Module Select View where user can select the Module Type
   * After the Module Type has been selected, these state items (Position and Menu ID) is used to pre-fill the Position Name and Menu ID

Here is a video demonstration of the overall frontend flow :

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/125059779-525ff200-e0c9-11eb-89c4-e60ccb5e19d4.mp4
 
<hr>

### Backend Flow:
Editing Modules in the Backend Admin Panel turned out to be a little tricky for the user if the template positions were not easy to visualize or if the User was unaware of the layout of the template positions. The old way for a user to get around this difficulty was to 
1. Visit the Global Configuration -> Templates -> Enable Template Positions
2. Visit Frontend
3. Append `?tp=1` as a param in the Page's URL (Might not be easy for users who do not have a technical background)
4. Remember the position name (Note: This view only shows active positions so they cannot even know where inactive positions are. Inactive means those positions that do not have a module to show in it)
5. Go back to the Admin Dashboard and select this position

To simplify all this into an easier and efficient method, a new modal has been added to select the positions via their preview. The video below demonstrates this new modal:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/125062858-783ac600-e0cc-11eb-9955-9fb4aa60c897.mp4

<hr>

### Testing Instructions
- Run `npm ci` because this PR involves re-building of assets
- Either run the SQL update script or download and install https://drive.google.com/file/d/1R4962C-MFFS236UW0cTBPn48DucG0-Qr/view?usp=sharing for the Add Module Button Plugin
- Test the frontend and backend placement flow summarized above. (The videos might be helpful)

<hr>

### Actual result AFTER applying this Pull Request
Refer to the two videos in the Summary of Changes section.

<hr>

### Documentation Changes Required
I'm not sure but I think this should be included in the Joomla Docs as a User Guide for the new feature.

<hr>

### Mentors
@chmst @nibra @bembelimen
(and thanks @richard67)

pr_title: [5.2] [GSoC 21] Core Enhancement 2 - Incorporation of Modules in Articles-Edit-View
pr_body:
Project Repo PR: https://github.com/joomla-projects/gsoc21_core-enhancements/pull/8 Plan Document: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Pl8JGa2hkYkmJzQOn9_mS8a4imDmqc2a/edit#heading=h.xzcjfqetxfhr
## Summary of Changes 1. **Create Module in Article Edit Screen**
Users can add Modules in Articles in Joomla. This is done with the help of the Module xtd-editor Plugin. However, this Plugin opens a Modal that only allows the user to select a pre-existing module, ie. there is no option to add a new module directly in the Article Edit View. To enhance that, this PR introduces a button to Create Modules directly in the Article Edit View:
![add module](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/125294497-f05df180-e341-11eb-9f98-d862a5d9185f.gif)
2. **Imported Modules Tab**
Note: To test this feature, you must enable "Show Imported Modules" in the com_content Global Configuration OR in the Configure Edit Screen Tab. Also, remember that the tab is only visible when you **Import a Module** and **Save** it.
![configure](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/125298326-a971fb00-e345-11eb-9202-028e9bc8bb95.gif) * Users have no option to ascertain information about the Modules imported in an article (they can only see the module id)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/125299068-67958480-e346-11eb-96a3-2a52fbcd9b8b.png) * Additionally, these modules cannot be directly edited in the Article Edit View.
![edit](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/125299003-55b3e180-e346-11eb-88b2-290dacb05dea.gif) * There is no user-friendly way to removing these modules. It requires a person to backspace the `{loadmoduleid id}` string from the article text which may not seem very intuitive to someone that is not tech-savvy. So to make this process more smooth, the users can now remove the tab with the click of a button in this tab
![remove](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/124258965-9ee88200-db4b-11eb-8ed4-793ab01c0e6d.gif) ### Testing Instructions 1. Run `npm ci` to rebuild the assets 2. Enable the Imported Modules Tab (Global Configuration -> Articles -> Editing Layout -> Show Imported Modules Switcher) 3. Follow the GIFs above ### Documentation Changes Required I'm not sure ### Mentors @chmst @nibra @bembelimen (and thanks @richard67)

pr_body:
Project Repo PR: https://github.com/joomla-projects/gsoc21_core-enhancements/pull/10

## Summary of Changes

### Access
- The corresponding access.xml actions have been added.

### Articles Model
- The `getListQuery()` method joins the old query with workflow_associations to also consider the workflow stages that belong to `com_content.articles` only.

### SQL Changes:
- The following have been added to the Database Tables:
    - 1 new workflow: `COM_WORKFLOW_BASIC_WORKFLOW_MODULES`
    - 1 new stage:  `COM_WORKFLOW_BASIC_STAGE`
    - 3 new transitions: Publish, Unpublish, and Trash
- Workflow Associations have been created for all existing modules via an update script / a query during Installation.

### Introduce a new Backend Menu Item
- A new menu item for Modules: Workflows to execute CRUD for `com_modules`

### Option to Enable Workflow Integration
- This can be toggled from Global Configuration

### Searchtools Filtering
- Option to filter modules via their stage

### ModulesComponent.php
- Added necessary functions that are used by Workflow Plugins (Workflows, Featuring and Publishing)

### Module Model
- The get query now takes into account the workflow stage associated with each module.
- Added Workflow before and after Save events
- Added a function to get the initial stage for a module (default workflow and default stage)
- Added a query to create workflow association while duplicating modules
- Added a function that prepares the workflow field

### Modules Model
- Join the query with workflow associations
- Add a filterForm function to filter based on workflow stage

### Modules Template:
- Added workflows column to the table
- This column is conditionally rendered when workflows are enabled
- Added workflows field to default batch body

## The Flow:
1. When creating new modules you have to select a workflow and when you save, the default stage under this workflow_id is set as the initial stage of the module.
2. When editing exiting modules, the workflow transition field is shown instead of the workflow_id field, which works similarly to com_content.

#### New Modules: Select Workflow 

(Permanent similar to workflow assignment for com_content)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/127371792-76191d17-2556-4147-be8d-6e95f835f657.png)


#### Edit Existing Modules: Transition Field

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/127372084-a33fff64-3a05-4189-a00e-0d6ac782b6f9.png)


## Testing Instructions

After a fresh install:
1, Go to Modules (Site or Admin) -> Options -> Integrations -> Enable Workflows
2. Test the transitions in modules view
3. Test CRUD for workflows, stages, and transitions in Modules: Workflows
4. Test Batch and Duplicate



## Expected result AFTER applying this Pull Request

Workflows are integrated into Modules and work as expected.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/129226377-79bddb17-7968-4bf7-9599-f206ff9853e2.mp4


## Documentation Changes Required

Possibly yes. Something on the lines of https://docs.joomla.org/Publishing_Workflow_Implementation#Implement_com_workflow_into_your_extension


## Mentors

@chmst @nibra @bembelimen
(And special thanks to @richard67)

pr_body:
Project Repo PR: https://github.com/joomla-projects/gsoc21_core-enhancements/pull/11 Plan Document: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Pl8JGa2hkYkmJzQOn9_mS8a4imDmqc2a/edit#heading=h.t5tri5tytv7q
- [x] Drop-down selector in Articles view - [x] Merge Model - [x] Merge tmpl files - [x] Merge View - [x] Merge Controller - [x] Update all links pointing to `view=featured` - [x] Update Link of Featured Articles Menu Item - [x] Remove Featured files ## Summary of Changes ### [A] New Selector Dropdown A searchtools selector is added that can be used to toggle between: Option | Value ------------ | ------------- All | "" Unfeatured | 0 Featured | 1 ![dropdown](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53610833/128350490-c5d83ab1-2ffb-42f7-8ecc-27cde5d658c5.gif)
### [B] Model Merged - A new method to return the featured selector filter parameter using the getUserState from request ```php $featured = $this->getUserStateFromRequest($this->context . '.featured', 'featured', ''); ``` - The advantage of the above is that we can also pass the value as a GET param to the URL which helps us to make redirect URLs that can initialize the value of this dropdown - `$featured` variable is used as a condition to manipulate the query to adjust to Featured
### [C] Templates Merged - We use `state->get('featured')` to conditonally render the template code as per featured or not.
### [D] Views Merged - We use `state->get('featured')` to conditonally render the toolbar options
### [E] Controller Merged - Merged the delete function from FeaturedController
## Testing Instructions - Visit the Articles View and ensure that everything works as it did before. - Test workflows and filters too - Ensure that the tmpl and view (and all other MVC files) are common for both featured and articles
## Expected result AFTER applying this Pull Request Everything works normally
## Mentors @chmst @nibra @bembelimen (and thanks @richard67)
